intro: Alsine macrocarpa lusus subfalcata, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are fleshy and may be lobed or spatulate, while the flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
